Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: Hi! Just wondering who do I contact regarding listing of a new coin (still in development, but should be ready for launch in the next coming weeks)

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: @danielkaye listing where? In hyperdex?

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: @PTYX BarterDex

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: What's Hyper (will google)

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: HyperDEX runs on BarterDEX core

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: think of barterdex as the motor and hyperdex as the new car body

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex/releases

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: Looks good, and is listing also decentralized ?

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: On the phone but will read soon! Thanks

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: @PTYX, is it's just a UI essentially ?

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: yes its just another UI. If you are listed on BarterDEX, it can be on both. Same core.

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: I see, I was looking for a 'how to get listed'

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: Or if anyone involved with that is online here

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: Kinda defeats the idea of decentralization if you need to "get listed" doesn't it ?

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: by, well,  a centralized authority üòÉ

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: You just need to add your coin to https://github.com/jl777/coins with a PR

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: and test that your coin works by swapping it

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: probably the second one first

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: oh, and I just make a pull request on git ?

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: once its merged into the coins repo, it will be available in barterdex

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: interesting, thanks! Didn't see any of this on google

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: How often are requests merged btw? any idea?

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: Usually as soon as they're there afaik. @cipi would be the best person to ask

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @danielkaye just curious, is the new coin an asset chain?

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: @Alright nope, just a fork from pivx with some functions (related to file sharing)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Not all that familiar with PIVX, but have you considered using an asset chain?

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: I could look into it if it doesn't require some massive code base changes

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: PIVX is a fork of DASH üòÉ

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: RPC-wise same as BTC more or less

Author: Alright#0419
Content: What are you trying to accomplish with the coin?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: An asset chain would likely be easy to use, and it comes with a ton of benefits

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Does your fork have BIP65 activated?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: It's required for barterdex integration

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: dash is in barterdex and I think pivx is as well, so that shouldn't be an issue with barterdex

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: but I agree, assetchain is probably a better way to go

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: inherit all the great KMD features, including CryptoConditions

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: I see, Komodo is forked from zcash

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: but for the functions of our coin we need masternode and budget proposals (and superblocks)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: there's an existing smart contract that can emulate a MN rewards scheme

Author: Alright#0419
Content: No contract for budget proposals or superblocks, but I'm sure they would be possible to develop

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Can add any new smart contracts you might need later on also

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Alright, I'm done with my asset chain shill üòõ

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
check out https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/FSM/src/cc/CC%20made%20easy
when you have some time though

Author: Alright#0419
Content: is an explanation of komodo smart contracts and how someone might build on top of them

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: In general almost everything you can imagine can be built on CC smarts since they are Turing complete

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: haha I'll take a look @Alright - thanks for the info (and shiling lol)

Author: danielkaye#6246
Content: @TonyL @Alright , could prolly do it but that would require a whole redesign of a lot of already done work

Author: Ludom#5832
Content: Someone here is in Lisboa?

Author: Ludom#5832
Content: If you are in Lisboa, could you pm me?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: @danielkaye please make sure your coin's wallet has BIP65 implemented (DASH has it, PIVX not)... `grep -Ri checklock *` in the source directory should show some results

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: hi there, I remember there was a way when creating assetchains to avoid getting 0.000X coins created after ac_end=1 and with ac_reward=0

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: mmm maybe ac_reward=0.0001 & ac_end=1 ??

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: was it something like this?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Sorry, not sure I understand the question

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what are you trying to accomplish? A chain with no block rewards?

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: right

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just ac_end=1

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ac_reward can be anything

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: mmm with ac_reward=0 it keeps adding coins every block

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do ac_reward=1?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ac_reward of non-zero

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: yes thats what I thought

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: will try that thx

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @kimmel (Pungo.io) if you want on-demand blocks you can omit ac_reward entirely

Author: Alright#0419
Content: as in nodes will only mine blocks when there is a tx in the mempool

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: done üòÉ thx

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: mmm I created a new one with ac_reward=0.0001 and during first 128 blocks (still on it) it keeps adding coins

Author: kimmel (Pungo.io)#2275
Content: will try without ac_reward...
